intro: Bistorta pergracilis, commonly known as slender bistorta, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense colonies. The leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their astringent properties.
